messages.title: Dear Neighbour
messages.content: Bristol has been my home for the last thirty years. I came here to study history at Bristol University and have been living and working in our great community ever since. I've dedicated my life to public service - as an advisor to independent family businesses, not coming from a privileged background myself and I experienced harsh poverty. I know how the school made me the success. Determined to succeed and tenacious in my studies, with crucial support from teachers at school gave me the confidence to do well and aim high.

messages.title: Personal determination and support
messages.content: Without their support early in life I would not have gone on to be elected as your MP in 2005, serving Bristol for a decade. Now, as the my Government's Minister for Communities, I am even more determined to make Britain a fairer country.

messages.title: Improving public services and environment
messages.content: In my adult life I have needed the help of the NHS in Bristol to manage my neurological condition. I am proud that the Liberal Democrats are saying the NHS should have an additional £8 billion it needs. It's on the front of our manifesto, along with another cut in income tax for the low paid. It's a party of government we have protected civil liberties, fought to protect nature, improve public transport and reduce carbon emissions.

messages.title: Community Engagement
messages.content: I've enjoyed working with many community groups over the years to protect and enhance amenities in Redland, Bishopston and on Gloucester Road and Whiteladies Road. And Clifton too. And have also fought for government money to expand our popular local primary schools.

messages.title: Continued Representation
messages.content: I hope that I will have your support to represent you for another five years in Parliament.

messages.title: Tactical Voting Situation
messages.content: Remember that Bristol West is on a clear choice between me and Labour.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Advocating for an additional £8 billion funding for the NHS as part of their manifesto.
Supporting further income tax cuts for the low paid.
Protecting civil liberties, fighting to protect nature, improving public transport, and reducing carbon emissions.
Fought for government money to expand popular local primary schools.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Bristol West is on a clear choice between me (Stephen Williams) and Labour.

politicalExperience.achievements: Determined to make Britain a fairer country.
Served Bristol for a decade, worked on public services, civil liberties, and environment improvement.

contactInformation.address: Unit 6, Fenton Court, Fenton Road, Bishopston, Bristol, BS7 8ND
